TITLE: Why the father of 'life planning' says you're managing money the wrong way
SUMMARY: George Kinder, recognized as the founder of financial life planning, thinks consumers are shortchanging themselves by putting off goals until retirement age.

TITLE: ETFs are on pace to break record annual inflows, but this wild card could change it all
SUMMARY: ETF inflows could rise as investors begin to search for other opportunities outside of money market funds.

TITLE: 3 ways Wall Street's largest banks are leveraging AI to increase profitability
SUMMARY: Top finance leaders are becoming convinced that the tech will transform their businesses.

TITLE: U.S. job market slows, but it's not yet a 'three-alarm fire,' economist says
SUMMARY: The labor market has shown unambiguous signs of cooling, economists said. Recession could follow if the trajectory continues.

TITLE: China should focus on fighting deflationary pressure, former central bank governor says
SUMMARY: China's policymakers need to focus on boosting domestic demand, Yi Gang, former head of the People's Bank of China, said Friday at the Bund Summit in Shanghai.

TITLE: 7-Eleven's parent company rejects $38.6 billion takeover bid, says offer 'grossly undervalues' company
SUMMARY: Even if the offer was raised "very significantly," Seven & i said the bid does not consider the "multiple and significant challenges" it would face.

TITLE: China's wealthy are increasingly looking overseas for business investment opportunities
SUMMARY: China's wealthy want to pursue business opportunities abroad, rather than just investment returns, according to asset managers and consultants.

TITLE: JPMorgan top economist says the Fed should cut rates by a half point this month
SUMMARY: JPMorgan chief U.S. economist Michael Feroli believes there is a strong case for the Federal Reserve to speed up the pace of rate cuts.

TITLE: How high earners can funnel money to a Roth IRA, the 'gold standard' of retirement accounts
SUMMARY: High earners may find it tricky to access tax breaks in individual retirement accounts. A workaround may help.

TITLE: Visa debuts a new product designed to make it safer to pay directly from your bank account
SUMMARY: Visa said it plans to launch a dedicated service for bank transfers, skipping credit cards and the traditional direct debit process.

TITLE: Cramer names the No. 1 underappreciated megacap to buy in the recent tech stock sell-off
SUMMARY: Microsoft's gen AI prospects are impressive, but the stock has more to offer investors than just the new tech.

TITLE: Ken Griffin’s Wellington hedge fund at Citadel squeezes out 1% gain in volatile August
SUMMARY: Citadel's multistrategy Wellington fund gained about 1% in August, bringing its year-to-date return to 9.9%.

TITLE: Robinhood lets Brits lend shares for extra income in bid to grow international footprint
SUMMARY: Robinhood on Wednesday launched a new feature in the U.K. allowing users to lend out any stocks they own outright in their portfolio to interested borrowers.

TITLE: Nvidia $279 billion wipeout — the biggest in U.S. history — drags down global chip stocks
SUMMARY: In the U.S., chipmaker Nvidia plunged more than 9% in regular trading, leading semiconductor stocks lower amid a sell-off on Wall Street.

TITLE: Klarna rival Zilch posts first profit and appoints ex-Aviva CEO to board ahead of IPO
SUMMARY: Philip Belamant, Zilch's CEO, told CNBC the firm was able to hit profitability by growing rather than cutting back like other fintechs have done.

TITLE: China's property woes and U.S. sanctions have hit some cities hard
SUMMARY: Hangzhou, capital of the eastern Zhejiang province and home to Alibaba and other tech companies, ranked first in this year's rankings.

TITLE: American demand for international trips drives 'travel momentum' and overall spending
SUMMARY: Americans' spending on international trips has underpinned overall travel strength.

TITLE: Is the Fed 'sleepwalking into a policy mistake?': Abrdn analyst calls for faster easing of rates
SUMMARY: Is the economy already weaker than the headline data suggests and should the U.S. Federal Reserve already be easing? Akintewe questioned on "Squawk Box Asia."

TITLE: China's first global gaming hit sells millions in a week. An early investor shares what's next
SUMMARY: China's first attempt at a top-tier video game has smashed world records, bolstering the industry's global ambitions after Beijing's gaming crackdown.

TITLE: Warren Buffett leads Berkshire Hathaway to new heights at age 94
SUMMARY: "It's been a matter of a well thought out strategy prosecuted for seven decades with discipline, consistency, and unusual insight," Oaktree's Howard Marks said.

TITLE: Dollar General shares crater 25% as retailer cuts outlook, blaming 'financially constrained' customers
SUMMARY: The discount retailer slashed its guidance for full-year same-store sales and profit.

TITLE: ‘Vigorous give and take’: U.S. security advisor discusses economic curbs in rare trip to China
SUMMARY: U.S. national security advisor Jake Sullivan said he raised concerns about the country's focus on economic security in meetings with Chinese officials.

TITLE: China's electric car race is becoming more about chip prowess as companies focus on tech
SUMMARY: Price wars aside, Chinese electric car companies are now competing on driver-assist and other tech powered by semiconductors.

TITLE: Biden and Xi to speak after rare U.S. security advisor trip to China
SUMMARY: The announcement came amid U.S. national security advisor Jake Sullivan's trip to Beijing this week to meet with Wang Yi, China's top diplomat.

TITLE: 401(k) auto-enrollment features don’t help savings as much as expected, study finds
SUMMARY: Academics who helped pioneer research on 401(k) auto-enrollment find effects such as leakage blunt its long-term impact.

TITLE: Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway hits $1 trillion market value, first U.S. company outside of tech to do so
SUMMARY: The milestone came two days before Buffett's 94th birthday.

TITLE: U.S. government researchers visit a Korean mine as the race against China for critical minerals heats up
SUMMARY: The Sangdong Mine, owned by a subsidiary of Canada-based Almonty Industries, is set to resume operations this year.

TITLE: JD.com shares climb after announcing $5 billion share buyback, outperforming decline in Hang Seng
SUMMARY: The announcement is JD.com's second buyback this year, after announcing a $3 billion buyback in March.

TITLE: Chinese EV company Xpeng sees shares pop 6% after it launches mass-market car
SUMMARY: Xpeng shares rose after the Chinese electric car company said prices for its new mass-market Mona brand would start as low as $16,812, far below that of Tesla.

TITLE: Dollar General, Dollar Tree and Kroger customers pay over $90 million a year in cash-back fees, federal agency finds
SUMMARY: Some big retailers have been levying a fee on customers who ask for cash back on purchases. That disproportionately hurts those in banking deserts.
